meanings.definition: A person who sells or deals in salt.
meanings.sent1: The salters at the market had different types of salt for sale.
meanings.sent2: The local salter always had the best quality salt.
meanings.sent3: The salters decided to have a salt-themed party to celebrate their successful sales.
meanings.sent4: She was a true salter, spreading kindness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The salters' market stall was a colorful display of various salts from around the world.

meanings.definition: A container for holding or dispensing salt.
meanings.sent1: The chef reached for the salter to season the dish.
meanings.sent2: The salters in the kitchen were neatly organized on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the salter, creating a salty mess.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a salter, preserving memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The antique salter was a beautiful addition to her collection of kitchenware.

meanings.definition: A type of vehicle used for spreading salt on roads.
meanings.sent1: The city hired salters to clear the icy roads during winter.
meanings.sent2: The salter drove slowly, ensuring the salt was spread evenly.
meanings.sent3: The salter vehicle looked like a giant salt shaker on wheels.
meanings.sent4: The salter moved through the streets like a silent snowplow.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange salter stood out against the white snow-covered roads.
